verse: When you make a vow to God, do not delay in fulfilling it, for God has no pleasure in fools. Fulfill the vow you have made.
It is preferable not to make a vow than to make it and fail to fulfill it.
Do not allow your mouth to lead you into sin and then plead before Godâ€™s messenger that it was all a mistake. Otherwise God will become angered at your words and destroy the work of your hands.
A profusion of dreams leads to excessive vanity. Therefore, fear God.

Under the Pretext of General Interests. If in some part of the realm you witness the oppression of the poor and the violation of rights and justice, do not be surprised; for every high official is supervised by one who is higher in rank, and the one who has the highest rank keeps watch over them all.
A country is best served when a king is in charge of the fertile fields.
There is a grievous evil that I have seen under the sun:
This too is a grievous evil:

The Happiness Suitable for Humans. This is the conclusion I have reached: it is fitting for a man to eat and drink and find satisfaction in the results of his labors under the sun during the brief span of life that God has allotted him.
Moreover, the one to whom God grants wealth and possessions and the ability to enjoy them and to find contentment in his toil receives a gift from God.
For it is unlikely that he will brood about the passing years inasmuch as God keeps his heart filled with joy.
